author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Writers Read at Camden library
text:
Writers Read at Camden library Oct 21, 2015 This year’s Writers Read event will feature, front from left, Bob Olfenbuttel and Marilyn Muth; in back, Ken Keoughan, Gin Mackey, Norbert Nathanson, Carol Luchetti, Barbara Furey and Peter Muth; and, not pictured, Marilyn Hotch and Carolyn Russ. 
Camden — The dedicated writers of the Coastal Senior College Writers’ Group will give readings from their current work at the Writers Read Monday, Nov. 2, at 1 p.m. at the downtown Camden Public Library. 
Writers Read features authors from Marilyn Muth’s writing group, presenting their own poems and short stories. This annual presentation has attracted a larger audience for each of the past five years, an audience that has greatly enjoyed hearing examples of the creativity and humor of some of their fellow Coastal Senior College members. 
“We have all been continually impressed and amazed at what these lively minds have brought forth, and feel certain that you will, too,” said Jack Farlow, volunteer and instructor at Senior College. 
As has been the case in past years, this event is co-sponsored by Coastal Senior College and the Camden Public Library. The event is free and all are welcome to attend. 
“We aim to benefit from the members’ different skills and experience,” said Muth. “We are our own audience and critics, and we enjoy this opportunity to read for the public!” 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
